documents.title: peterborough junk amnesty aims to curb fly-tipping
text: bulky waste will be collected for free in peterborough as the city council looks to cut down on fly-tipping in the city .

it usually costs £ 23 to have the city council collect items such as furniture and old fridges , but the three-month trial means people can have a one-off collection of up to 10 large items for free .
officers will be assessing the scheme later to see whether free bulky waste collections have reduced fly-tipping incidents .
the council recently said clearing up fly-tipped waste costs it more than £ 200,000 a year .

documents.title: suffolk police to ask government to cover corrie mckeague investigation
text: suffolk police is to ask the government to cover the cost of its investigation into the disappearance of airman corrie mckeague , the county 's police and crime commissioner said .
tim passmore said he is expecting to sign-off the application to the home office this week .
he said the investigation , which started after mr mckeague , who was stationed at raf honington , went missing in bury st edmunds on 24 september 2016 , has cost the force up to £ 1.6m .
it has included the search of a landfill site at milton , near cambridge , which ended yesterday with no trace of the serviceman .

mr passmore said he thought it would be `` only reasonable '' for the government to cover the cost , especially after it funded the £ 1.1m towards the controversial police investigation into allegations of sexual abuse against sir edward heath in wiltshire .

documents.title: train disruption continues after lorry hits bridge
text: this is the scene at ely station this morning , with rail passengers gathered on the platform waiting for updates after a lorry hit a bridge .
`` significant damage '' was caused to the bridge near eccles road station in norfolk , with some debris falling onto the track , a network rail spokeswoman said .
british transport police said the top of the bridge was struck at about 05:30 , closing all lines between thetford and attleborough .
disruption is expected on greater anglia trains between cambridge and norwich - check the last information here .
east midlands trains have also been affected , with its norwich services now starting and finishing at ely or peterborough ( route below ) and alternative arrangements were in place .
engineers were due to be working on repairs for the rest of the day , network rail said .

documents.title: peterborough nightshelter opens as temperatures plummet
text: seven churches have got together with peterborough city council to open a winter nightshelter in the city , along with an emergency shelter , prompted by plummeting temperatures .
the new haven facility in towler street opened on monday and is expected to run until march .
a second emergency shelter for the homeless has opened in oundle road , which will only operate during low temperatures .

irene walsh , cabinet member for communities , said : `` there are a range of services and options that are made available and offered to every rough sleeper , including a winter night shelter and support for those who are struggling with mental health issues or are reliant on drugs or alcohol .
`` in addition , the emergency provision will be in place until temperatures rise . ''

text: rail services between ely in cambridgeshire and norwich are expected to be disrupted all day after a vehicle hit a bridge causing `` significant damage '' .

until repairs have been carried out , the line between thetford and attleborough will be closed .
it is anticipated it will remain shut until at least the end of the day , the company says on its website .
east midlands trains services will not run between ely and norwich .
greater anglia services may be cancelled or amended .
buses are running between ely and norwich .
you can find out more details about how your journey could be affected here .

they have now stopped their second search of a landfill site at milton near cambridge as part of their inquiry into his disappearance in bury st edmunds in september 2016 .

documents.title: peak of perfection
text: the uk has a new highest mountain , thanks to scientists at cambridge-based british antarctic survey .

meet mount hope - in the part of the antarctic claimed by the uk - it was recently re-measured by the organisation 's map makers and found to tower above the previous title holder , mt jackson , by a good 50m ( 160ft ) .
it 's not quite hitting the heady heights of mount everest - at a whopping 8,848m - but you can read more about how hope measures up from the bbc 's science correspondent , jonathan amos , here .

documents.title: security guards to patrol peterborough taxi ranks
text: security marshals will be guarding taxi ranks in parts of peterborough in the run-up to christmas in a bid to stem anti-social behaviour .
two security industry authority ( sia ) -registered marshals will patrol the broadway and northminster ranks each weekend between now and new year 's eve .
they will carry body-worn cameras and radios which will give them access to cctv and the police .

the scheme 's been developed by the safer peterborough partnership , cambridgeshire police and the city council , and aims to prevent alcohol-fuelled anti-social behaviour and ensure passengers can get taxis quickly and safely .

the hull trains service from london king 's cross came to a halt at helpston after sustaining what the company described as `` catastrophic engine failure '' .
passengers were stuck on board for more than four hours , many complaining of no water or working toilets , while the fuel leak was cleared and a rescue train organised .
they have now been moved from the stricken train , but passengers using services between london and the north east are still being warned about delays .

documents.title: train fuel leak was 'catastrophic failure ' of engine
text: the managing director of hull trains has apologised to passengers and praised staff on a train which was stranded after a fuel leak between peterborough and grantham .

earlier today , hull trains , network rail and the train 's driver thought something struck the train between peterborough and grantham which ruptured the fuel tanks .
once our train inspectors were at work alongside network rail , it was actually clear it is a catastrophic failure of the engine which has caused the damage to the unit . ''

documents.title: cambridge news printed 11,000 copies with headline gaffe
text: a newspaper published 11,000 copies of an edition which included instructions to writers on the front page instead of a headline , it has revealed .
the cambridge news left `` 100pt splash heading here '' in place of the intended headline about a `` sex lair '' school on most of wednesday 's papers .
the cambridge news apologised yesterday for a `` technical error '' , but the paper 's owner trinity mirror has since refused to say what the error was or how it went unnoticed .
a spokesman said 11,000 copies had the erroneous headline , but 3,000 of the cambourne edition ran the correct headline .
he said : `` the company will be saying nothing further on this matter other than to reiterate the apology issued by the cambridge news yesterday . ''

early reports of a fire on board the train have been dismissed by network rail which said the driver thought she saw smoke , but it was later confirmed there was none .

a network rail spokeswoman said passengers remained on board and the train would be towed to a station to enable them to leave .
no-one was injured , but passengers using east midlands , grand central , hull trains and virgin trains services have been told to expect long delays or cancellations .

text: there are problems on the east coast mainline at the moment after a hull trains service suffered a fuel leak after hitting something on the tracks which ruptured fuel tanks .
the affected service is the 09:48 train from london to hull and it 's currently at a standstill between peterborough and grantham .
network rail says the driver reported hitting something and seeing smoke so the train was brought to a stop .
there was no smoke in the carriages so passengers did n't need to be evacuated , according to network rail .
the company adds that the train is going to be towed away as soon as possible , the fuel spill is being cleared up and nearby track is being inspected to ensure there 's no obstruction .
two of the four lines have now reopened , so trains are once again moving through the area .

a bomb disposal unit has been called and a precautionary safety cordon has been established around the site .
police have told the public not be concerned by loud noises as there are likely to be controlled explosions .
the cambridge news is currently doing live coverage .

documents.title: council bid to contribute to school 's refurbishment
text: a village secondary school is to receive £ 2m from the county council towards a huge renovation - as staff work to turn its fortunes around .
sawtry village academy was placed in special measures in 2014 - and in october 2017 former headteacher james stewart was jailed for four years for misconduct and fraud .
the school has more than 1,200 pupils aged 11 to 18 and is now making good progress , according to ofsted , after a change in leadership .
the so-called `` one-off capital investment '' would address what the council describes as `` serious health , safety and wellbeing issues '' .

`` officers consider that there is a compelling case for the council to support the health , safety and wellbeing of sawtry 's secondary aged children by making a major contribution of £ 2 million to sawtry village academy 's much needed redevelopment , '' the report says .
it continues : `` local authority officers are in no doubt that the condition of the buildings has been seriously affected by the failings in school leadership . ''
author: Orla Moore

documents.title: airbnb house could be breaching planning rules , says council
text: cambridge city council is considering slapping an enforcement notice on a property in the city that 's being let out with online letting firm 'airbnb ' .
the council has received complaints about `` noise disturbance '' and the frequency of lets at the house on richmond road .
it is advertised on the 'airbnb ' website as a three-bedroom home for up to five guests , although the owner says he lives there two or three days a week .
here 's what the council rules say about short-term letting :
the council is to consider whether the owner is committing a planning breach by letting it out for more than their 90-day rule on short term lets .

documents.title: plans for 'all-through school ' in chatteris
text: chatteris could become home to the county 's first ever `` all through school '' - which would see primary , secondary and sixth form pupils all educated on the same site .
cambridgeshire county council is considering plans that would see cromwell community college grow to extend its pupil age range from four to 18 .
chatteris has a growing demand for school places , especially with new homes planned for hallam land .
plans for a new primary school locally recently fell through .
fenland education officer ian trafford described the idea as `` exciting '' .
chatteris is n't the only part of cambridgeshire that 's faced challenges with school places .
in the last six years , peterborough city council has created nearly 3000 extra school places across primary and secondary level - and still has plans to boost the numbers by 750 .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council to consider interest in former outdoor centre
text: a working party will meet later this month to look at the options on the table for a beleaguered outdoor complex near ely .
the mepal outdoor centre - which has catered for schools and community groups since the 1980s - closed after a break-in and fire in december 2016 .
the window for any parties to express an interest in taking on the facility closed at 17:00 on monday .
the 12 hectares ( 30 acres ) site includes a boating lake , 38-bed student accommodation block and camping area .
east cambridgeshire district council will discuss the next move at a meeting on 18 december .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: teacher killed in crash was a 'very special role model '
text: the king edward vi school in bury st edmunds has paid tribute to a former teacher who died in a collision on the a1123 at haddenham near ely on friday .
an article on the school 's website says : `` we are deeply shocked and saddened to learn of the death of former king edward vi teacher , mark jones .
`` mark was an exceptional teacher .
he was creative , passionate and talented ; all in equal measure .
`` he joined the staff team in december 2015 on a maternity cover in media , yet demonstrated his immense versatility by going on to teach drama and physics .
`` whatever the subject matter , mark taught with authority , proficiency and humour .
`` while maintaining utter professionalism , mark made no secret of any part of who he was .
as a result , he was a very special role model to a great many students .
`` the prevailing mood here at king edward vi school is one of deep sadness .
`` rising to the surface , however , are the memories of a wonderfully positive man who we were privileged to have called a colleague and a friend . ''
mr jones , 38 , of elms road , freckenham near bury st edmunds was driving a blue mazda mx5 , which collided with a white vauxhall astra envoy at about 07:50 on friday .

documents.title: south cambs and cambridge may bid for housing cash
text: two of the county 's local authorities are considering a joint bid for government cash to speed up house building .
housing and planning minister , alok sharma mp , told the house of commons that £ 25m will be made available to `` ambitious '' councils via the planning delivery fund .
councils will be able to apply for a share of the money to move projects along .

councillor peter topping , conservative leader of south cambridgeshire district council , said : `` tens of thousands of new jobs are likely to be created in the medium term , so having the new homes , where the people taking those jobs can live , is vital . ''

councillor lewis herbert , labour leader of cambridge city council , added : `` our major opportunities and challenges are the same as our friends and neighbours , and this finance would help us protect what is most precious about both our historic city and our rural environment . ''

text: designated drivers can get free soft drinks at selected pubs and clubs across cambridgeshire over the christmas period .
the scheme - run by the cambridgeshire & peterborough road safety partnership ( cprsp ) - has been put in place to encourage drivers to stay off the alcohol .
all they have to do is ask for an `` i 'm des '' wristband from staff .
pc jon morris , casualty reduction officer for cambridgeshire police , said : `` any amount of alcohol affects your ability to drive so we are asking people to do one or the other .
`` we advise if you 're drinking , even just one , do n't drive and arrange an alternative way of getting home . ''
the campaign will be promoted throughout peterborough , fenland , huntingdonshire and cambridge until the new year .

documents.title: celebrations to mark peterborough cathedral 's 900th birthday
text: more than a hundred events are being organised throughout 2018 to mark peterborough cathedral 's milestone 900th birthday .
the peterborough celebrates campaign will involve schools , businesses and charities in a year-long programme .
work began on the city 's gothic centrepiece in 1118 - but it was n't completed for 120 years .
spokeswoman liz hurst says the anniversary is a chance to commemorate the cathedral 's rich history - and develop its future .
`` it 's a beautiful building and it is at the heart of the city , '' she said .
`` that 's what we 're looking forward to with our 900th anniversary - we 're sharing it . ''

documents.title: abandoned mum-in-labour and puppies flourishing
text: two puppies born after their mum was abandoned in the freezing cold while she was in the middle of labour , are flourishing , their rescuers say .

when fenland animal rescue found bella , a chihuahua-terrier cross on 2 november in abbotsley near st neots , she was `` howling with pain '' , having been dumped in a wire crate in 1c ( 34f ) temperatures .
she had already given birth to one puppy , which had died , but two more were successfully delivered during an emergency caesarean .
four weeks later , the pair have `` turned into beautiful babies that now have a future filled with love and happiness '' , the charity 's founder josh flanagan says .

the charity , which is based in whittlesey and relies entirely on donations , says the veterinary costs in this case have been `` extensive '' , but volunteers are committed to `` ensuring every animal has a chance of survival '' .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

text: the park gates along cambridge 's st john 's street were transformed into a 1930s wartime movie set this week .
turns out they 've been filming a protest scene for red joan , a world war two spy drama , directed by ipswich-born trevor nunn and starring judi dench and tom hughes .
the film recounts the story of joan stanley , who was exposed as the kgb 's longest-serving british spy .

the movie is based on the book of the same name by jennie rooney , which , according to publishers penguin random house is `` inspired by the true story of melita norwood , a woman unmasked in 1999 , at age 87 , as the kgb 's longest-serving british spy , red joan centre on the deeply conflicted life of a brilliant young physicist during the second world war '' .

it says the link with the proposed oxford to cambridge expressway would cut across farmland it owns and make it less financial viable .
earth trust argues this would `` undermine '' its ability to manage the wittenham clumps in south oxfordshire and other `` national assets '' .
last month , the national infrastructure commission said the government should accelerate plans for a new expressway connecting oxford and cambridge .
its report said the new road would help boost the region 's contribution to the uk 's economy .

jasper , who belongs to deputy librarian simon frost , was supposed to wear a full elf costume for the event , but was `` having none of it '' .
`` he was n't keen on being an elf , but agreed reluctantly to wear the hat and collar , '' said mr frost .

text: the parents of matthew birkinshaw said their son 's death has left a `` space no-one else can ever fill '' .

they said : `` it is impossible to put into words the effect the loss of matthew has had on our family .

it has been heartbreaking to hear how when matt needed kindness and support , he met someone who wanted to do him harm . ''

john gilmurry said his wife jane had built up the collection of lemax models over 10 years , which is worth more than £ 8,000 .
he said : `` last year we used our dining room , but there is so much stuff our neighbours the graingers offered their double garage as its home this year . ''
the village will be opened to the public from 18:00 to 21:00 from today until 10 december .
all donations received will go the forces charity ssafa and the magpas air ambulance .

text: two men escaped apparently unhurt after their car plunged into a freezing river at whittlesey .

cambridgeshire police received a report that the grey citroen c4 was attempting to overtake another vehicle on north bank when it went into the water near millennium bridge .
`` two men were seen to leave the car and run away from the scene , '' a force spokeswoman said .
`` the helicopter was deployed to locate the men due to the freezing conditions and that they would be wet through . ''
the men have not yet been identified or found , she added , but the car was recovered at about 22:40 .

documents.title: neolithic women stronger than today 's cambridge rowers , study finds
text: prehistoric women had rather powerful biceps , a cambridge university study has found .
scientists at the department of archaeology scanned the bones of neolithic women and found that grain grinding and working the land gave them thicker and denser arms than their modern counterparts .
they compared women from 7,000 years ago to the current cambridge university women 's boat club squads , and found their arm bones were 11-16 % stronger .
lead scientist dr alison macintosh , said : `` this is the first study to actually compare prehistoric female bones to those of living women .
`` the repetitive arm action of grinding these stones together for hours may have loaded women 's arm bones in a similar way to the laborious back-and-forth motion of rowing . ''
the findings are published in the journal , science advances .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: great haddon homes : developers 'need more time '
text: the team behind a massive housing development for great haddon , near yaxley , is asking peterborough city council for more time to fine tune the plans before any work gets started .
planning permission for more than 5,300 homes was granted three years ago .
but the stumbling block has been the so-called section 106 agreement - that 's the money the developers have to provide for infrastructure like roads and schools .
in a statement , peterborough city council said it had been working with the developers on the `` practical delivery of what is a very large and complex development '' .
developers - collectively known as the great haddon consortium - are hoping for another three months in order to make sure the legal agreement is complete .

documents.title: skates are on for cambridge 's first ice rink
text: building work has begun to create a permanent ice rink on the edge of cambridge .
south cambridgeshire district council is providing a £ 1.85m loan to cambridge leisure and ice centre ( clic ) for the rink , which will be on land off newmarket road .
it could be up and ready by the autumn of 2018 .
the new 340-seat arena will hold a 56m x 26m ice pad , which will meet national ice hockey standards to attract teams from around the world .
simon edwards , cabinet member for finance , said : `` it was fantastic to be on the site where this time next year we should be skating , so i 'd better get practising now !

`` i 've no doubt that residents from across south cambridgeshire will be looking forward to tying up their ice skates and taking full advantage of having a world-class facility like this on their doorstep . ''

prof bill harris , chairman of clic , said : `` 20 years of campaigning for this community ice arena , which will be home for the cambridge university ice hockey team , one of the oldest ice-hockey clubs in the world , has been one of the great rides of my life .

`` it is thanks to the tireless work and generosity of scores of like-minded people in many sectors of the greater community , who appreciate the multitude of benefits that such a facility will bring to cambridge . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager remanded over cambourne double stabbing
text: a teenager has appeared in court charged with murdering a man and attempting to murder another outside a pub in cambourne .
village resident chris west , 30 , died from a stab wound to the heart after an attack by the monkfield arms in october .
a 26-year-old man suffered life-threatening injuries and survived .
kai nazir , 19 , of the crescent , st neots , appeared at cambridge crown court via a videolink from peterborough prison .
he 's also charged with causing grievous bodily harm with intent and possessing a blade .
no pleas were entered and he was remanded in custody until a further appearance in court in january .

documents.title: chatteris pays tribute to local man awarded for bravery in ww1
text: a pavement stone has just been unveiled in chatteris to remember the bravery of one its own .
george clare ( 1889-1917 ) was a stretcher-bearer with the 5th royal lancers during world war one .
he was awarded the victoria cross for his selfless actions saving others on the front line in the battle of cambrai .
veterans and locals have joined together to march in his honour - marking 100 years since pte clare 's death in a gas shell attack .
author: Orla Moore

documents.title: george clare remembered : letter from the front line
text: pte clare wrote a very detailed account of life on the front line to a friend in chatteris .
the letter was published in the cambridgeshire times , 100 years ago .
here 's a little of what it said
`` i should like you to see me now , i think you would hardly know me .
i have just come out of the trenches after ten days torrid experience such as i never dreamed of witnessing .

`` for instance in one dugout , a place where we get a few minutes sleep , we could see the feet of a soldier sticking out who had been buried there previously and you could see hands and sometimes faces and dead horses galore .
`` we had one of our officers shot through the head by a german sniper .
they are very good shots .
it is not safe to put your head over the trench for more than a minute or they have got you . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 100 years on : chatteris remembers bravery of george clare vc
text: the people of chatteris are paying tribute to a local world war one hero who died 100 years ago today .
george clare ( 1889-1917 ) was a stretcher-bearer with the 5th royal irish lancers .
he was awarded the victoria cross ( vc ) for his actions saving others .
a blue plaque and a pavement stone are being unveiled in his memory .
there will also be a parade through the fenland town , where clare street is named after him .
records held at the chatteris community archive say the young soldier , who was born in st ives but grew up and worked in chatteris , was on the front as early as march 1915 .
pte clare won the vc for his actions in the battle of cambrai .
his citation says : `` for most cons bravery and devotion to duty when , acting as a stretcher-bearer during a most intense and continuous enemy bombardment , pte .
clare dressed and conducted wounded over the open to the dressing-station about 500 yards away .

`` at the dressing-station he was told that the enemy was using gas shells and as the wind was blowing the gas towards the line of trenches and shell-holes occupied , he personally warned every company post of the danger , the whole time under shell and rifle fire .
`` this very gallant soldier was subsequently killed by a shell . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: last chance for your say on proposed cambridge parking zones
text: residents in parts of cambridge have one more week to have their say on four major parking schemes in the city .
the areas are off coleridge road ( coleridge west ) , barton road ( newnham ) , staffordshire street and shaftesbury road/brooklands avenue ( accordia ) .
the four zones would give priority to local residents in a city where parking is a premium .
the county council says : `` cambridge is a diverse city with local communities having different wants and needs .
`` this consultation focuses on four individual residents ' parking schemes ( rps ) which give locals priority over parking within their area . ''

documents.title: two injured in a1123 crash near wicken
text: the drivers of two cars involved in a rush-hour crash in rural cambridgeshire have been airlifted to hospital .
police were called to dimmock 's cote road , between stretham and wicken on the a1123 , at 06:52 .
it remains closed at the fish and duck marina .
the drivers , both women , were transferred by the ambulance service magpas to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening .

documents.title: car crashes into shop in cambridge
text: a woman has been treated in hospital for facial injuries after a car smashed into the front of a shop in cambridge in the early hours .
it happened on trinity street shortly after 04:15 .
police said the driver of the black mazda cx-5 fled the scene .
three people have also been detained for `` theft from the vehicle '' .
the shop front - of fashion chain comptoir des cotonniers - will be assessed this morning for structural damage .
the narrow road has since reopened .
a police spokeswoman said : `` a woman , believed to be a passenger in the car , suffered minor injuries to her face and has been taken to addenbrooke 's hospital .
`` the driver fled the scene and remains to be outstanding at this time . ''

documents.title: new agriculture technology park could bring 4,000 jobs
text: a massive new technology park which could provide employment for 4,000 people is being proposed for land near hinxton , in the south of the county .

if plans are approved , companies based at the agritech park will develop technologies to help farmers and others involved in the food chain to improve their performance , according to smithsonhill ltd , which has submitted its proposal to south cambridgeshire district council .
the park would have about 112,000 sq m ( 27 acres ) of employment space .
the applicants propose to change to the access to whittlesford parkway railway station , including a new foot and cycle bridge over the a505 , and a bus and cycle interchange on green belt land .
a public consultation on the plans closes on 4 january .

text: a man has died after he fell from a bridge and was hit by a lorry , police say .

the man was pronounced dead at the scene , cambridgeshire police say .
the incident is not being treated as sus

documents.title: what black friday ?
text: you may have read a lot of stories this morning about massive queues outside electrical stores and pushing and shoving in the aisles of supermarkets as black friday sales begin .
well , not in cambridge city centre .
the grand arcade , lion yard and the grafton shopping centres were all relatively quiet around opening time , despite `` sale '' signs in most shop windows .
we did n't spot any crowds jostling to bag a bargain but we think we saw some tumbleweed rolling along the near-deserted shopping streets .
